header_summary:
Sergio Demian Lerner and Boris Nagaev discussed enhancing Bitcoin's security against quantum threats by proposing a novel commit/reveal scheme using Taproot leaves for QR output, which simplifies transactions and avoids additional storage needs, aligning with Bitcoin's consensus rules ([source](https://groups.google.com/g/bitcoindev/c/jr1QO95k6Uc/m/lsRHgIq_AAAJ)). Meanwhile, Greg Sanders explored Citrea and nostr's potential in leveraging Bitcoin's core technologies for efficient transaction processing, emphasizing the importance of maintaining Layer 2 security models amidst technological innovations ([source](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/2a40a751-d0d1-4dc8-9dd5-67b7652ed8b8n@googlegroups.com)). 

In analyzing sybil resistance across CoinJoin implementations, /dev /fd0 identified JoinStr as offering superior resistance compared to others, inviting further discussion on enhancing cryptocurrency transaction security ([source](https://uncensoredtech.substack.com/p/sybil-resistance-in-coinjoin-implementations)). Concurrently, several mining pools have considered supporting non-standard transactions beyond the 100 kvB limit, sparking debate on the implications for Bitcoin's network efficiency and the decentralized nature of block creation ([source](https://www.coindesk.com/business/2025/05/27/bitlayer-joins-forces-with-antpool-f2pool-and-spiderpool-to-supercharge-bitcoin-defi)).

Lastly, a collaboration between ClaraShk and @deadmanoz culminated in a report on Bitcoin's quantum computing vulnerabilities, proposing strategies for the ecosystem to adapt, underscoring the urgency in addressing these future challenges ([source](https://chaincode.com/bitcoin-post-quantum.pdf)). Additionally, the Lightning Network's consideration of forwarding delays to balance node incentives with efficiency gains reflects ongoing efforts to optimize network performance without compromising privacy or user autonomy ([source](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/latency-and-privacy-in-lightning/1723/9)).

active_posts.summary:

active_posts.summary:

active_posts.title: Dust Expiry: Clean the UTXO set from spam
active_posts.summary:
- UTXO set expansion due to spam has led to a soft-fork proposal for dust output expiration.
- The UTXO set doubled since 2023, influenced by spam, reaching 11 GB.
- The proposal allows removing old, small UTXOs to reduce and clean the set.
